One longtime GOP presidential-campaign adviser supportive of Mitt Romney puts it more bluntly: Hanging around waiting for the Tea Party to find you should Mitt Romney stumble is hardly a proven nominating strategy. But being a movement conservative from the American heartland with two successful gubernatorial terms under your belt is more Reaganesque than- Reagan. Vin Weber , who is a Tim Pawlenty adviser, is an admirer of Mike Pence . "I'm not surprised," he says. "I think it's the right decision for him."
